snippet: The United States Embassy said it was “deeply disappointed” after a former governor, who was convicted in 2007, was pardoned this week.
abstract: United States Embassy in Nigeria criticizes pardoning of Diepreye Alamieyeseigha, former governor who was convicted of corruption, in Twitter message, which is picked up by Nigerian media; criticism fuels growing fracas over pardon.
lead_paragraph: The United States Embassy said it was “deeply disappointed” after a former governor, who was convicted in 2007, was pardoned this week.

headline.seo: U.S. Embassy Criticizes Pardons in Nigeria Corruption Cases
headline.main: U.S. Embassy Criticizes Pardons in Nigerian Corruption Cases
headline.print_headline: U.S. Embassy Criticizes Pardons In Nigerian Corruption Cases
